intro: Odontochilus nandae, commonly known as the Nanda's toothed orchid, is a rare and exquisite orchid species native to the mountainous regions of India. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique toothed lip, which gives it its scientific name. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid, thriving in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Its flowers are usually small and fragrant, displaying a range of colors from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Odontochilus nandae is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts to protect it.
